intro: Assonia greveana, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Assonia greveana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
